ACT
22
Adoption in case of relative adoption
With relative adoption, the adopter and his relatives on the one hand, and the adoptee and his descendants on the other hand, mutually acquire the right of legal inheritance.
With consanguineous adoption, the mutual right of legal inheritance between the adopted child and his blood relatives ceases.
If a child is adopted by a stepmother or stepfather, the inheritance rights between the adopted child and the parent who is married to the adoptive parent, and the blood relatives of that parent, do not cease.
